text.section: In this section, "camera" includes any electronic device that can be used surreptitiously to observe an individual.

A person may not place or procure another to place a camera on real property where a private residence is located to conduct deliberate surreptitious observation of an individual inside the private residence.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding $2,500 or both.
Subject to subsection (b)(1) of this section, it is not a defense to a prosecution under this section that the defendant owns the private residence.
A good faith reliance on a court order is a complete defense to a civil or criminal action brought under this section.

section.section: An individual who was observed through the use of a camera in violation of this section has a civil cause of action against any person who placed or procured another to place the camera on the real property.
In an action under this subsection, the court may award damages and reasonable attorney's fees.

text.section: This section does not affect any legal or equitable right or remedy otherwise provided by law.
